land_type_description_city: Dense urban hub; balanced housing and modest militia slots keep trade and order steady.
land_type_description_kingdom: Semi-sovereign crown beneath an overlord realm; strong housing and levies, yet ambition and distance erode loyalty unless backed by imperial authority.
land_type_description_state: Provincial center with delegated bureaucracy; generous housing and levy slots, but regional autonomy tugs at loyalty.
land_type_description_village: Small rural settlement; kinship keeps loyalty high while housing stays limited and militias are disallowed.
nation_type_description_anarcho_state: Loose communes slow builds and thin militias; wartime pressure can push a warband champion forward, but authority rarely lasts.
nation_type_description_anarchy: No formal ruler; loyalty and levies erode, and only in crisis might a ruthless warlord temporarily seize the mantle.
nation_type_description_autocracy: Centralized rule by a sole autocrat; a single ruler acts fast, yet stability hinges entirely on that leader.
nation_type_description_barony: Petite feudal holding led by a baron; tight-knit nobility and a single seat keep order but limit reach.
nation_type_description_caliphate: Theocratic state under a caliph; faith-driven unity fuels campaigns, though strict piety burdens daily life.
nation_type_description_chiefdom: Single chief leads allied clans; charismatic chiefs bind clans together; succession wars ignite easily.
nation_type_description_city_state: Sovereign city with minimal hinterland; dense urban core fuels culture and wealth, yet tiny borders invite conquest.
nation_type_description_clan_state: State built on kinship clans; kinship loyalty unites families, but blood feuds can shatter leadership.
nation_type_description_commonwealth: Voluntary association bound by heritage; common heritage builds trust, even as member interests quietly diverge.
nation_type_description_confederation: Loose league of sovereign states; sovereign members cooperate loosely, making joint decisions hard to enforce.
nation_type_description_constitutional_r: Republic bound by a supreme constitution; rule of law shields rights, though courts can halt bold plans.
nation_type_description_county: Regional county under a count; broader lands than a barony, balancing local loyalties with growing ambition.
nation_type_description_democratic_repub: Mass-franchise republic; popular mandate grants legitimacy, but party infighting shortens horizons.
nation_type_description_despotate: Autocratic state run by a despot; iron rule stifles rebellions, but unchecked power lets resentment simmer.
nation_type_description_diarchy: Two rulers hand off leadership to the strongest diplomatusually from the capitalgaining a city militia slot but trimming central levies.
nation_type_description_divine_kingdom: Monarch worshiped as a living god; ruler hailed as a living deity, yet whispers of heresy threaten stability.
nation_type_description_duchy: Feudal domain under a duke; tight feudal bonds secure loyalty, but it lacks the prestige to lead great coalitions.
nation_type_description_ecclesiarchy: Priestly bureaucracy governs; priestly governance enforces doctrine, while zealots police daily life.
nation_type_description_emirate: Semi-autonomous domain ruled by an emir; trade-minded courts attract merchants, while patronage politics stir resentment.
nation_type_description_empire: Multi-ethnic realm ruled by an emperor; commands vast lands through authority, yet overextension and court intrigue sap focus.
nation_type_description_federal_republic: Republic of semi-autonomous regions; regions keep autonomy while united, yet coordination needs constant negotiation.
nation_type_description_federation: Union with a strong federal center and regions; shared institutions pool strength, yet layered bureaucracy slows response.
nation_type_description_free_city: Autonomous mercantile city; guild-led autonomy drives trade, but lacking a hinterland means thin supplies.
nation_type_description_gerontocracy: Rule by the eldest; experienced elders steer policy, though age slows new ideas.
nation_type_description_grand_duchy: Elevated duchy with ceremonial weight; ceremony and lineage impress allies, yet grandeur expectations strain taxes.
nation_type_description_hanseatic_league: Northern maritime trade league; northern trade network guarantees wealth, but consensus politics delay mobilization.
nation_type_description_hierocracy: Power held by a higher clergy hierarchy; ranked priesthood channels devotion, yet rigid hierarchy resists change.
nation_type_description_holy_state: Secular power fused with sacred mission; sacred symbols inspire subjects, but missionary zeal alienates outsiders.
nation_type_description_khanate: Steppe monarchy ruled by a khan; nomadic ferocity keeps foes wary, yet succession rides on charisma, not law.
nation_type_description_kingdom: Hereditary monarchy led by a royal house; stable royal lineage keeps nobles loyal but slows reforms.
nation_type_description_mandate_state: Authority claimed by divine mandate; spiritual mandate rallies the masses, but religious quotas stall pragmatism.
nation_type_description_maritime_republi: Naval republic built on fleets; naval mastery guards sea lanes; shipyards consume manpower and gold.
nation_type_description_merchant_republi: Oligarchic republic of merchant houses; sea trade fills the coffers, while rival guilds keep policy reactive.
nation_type_description_nomadic_horde: Mobile tribal host; high mobility terrorizes foes, yet lack of infrastructure drains endurance.
nation_type_description_noocracy: Council of scholars prizes diplomacy and renown when picking a chair; states grow loyal while centralized armies thin out.
nation_type_description_parliamentary_re: Republic with executive drawn from parliament; coalitions keep ministers accountable; fragile alliances topple cabinets.
nation_type_description_peoples_republic: Centralized socialist republic; central planning mobilizes resources, but personal freedoms stay suppressed.
nation_type_description_port_state: Harbor-centric polity; busy harbors pour taxes in, yet reliance on trade makes blockades crippling.
nation_type_description_principality: Small sovereign ruled by a prince; compact realm rules nimbly, though it leans on stronger neighbors for protection.
nation_type_description_republic: Citizen-led state with an elected executive; citizens shape policy, though elections slow crisis responses.
nation_type_description_sacred_dominion: Mystic rites legitimize rule; arcane rites bind the realm, though divine bureaucracy ignores mundane needs.
nation_type_description_sheikhdom: Tribal monarchy under a sheikh; clan loyalty keeps order, though tribal succession feuds flare easily.
nation_type_description_sultanate: Islamic monarchy headed by a sultan; religious authority rallies armies, but factional courts constantly vie for favor.
nation_type_description_tetrarchy: Four councils favor silver tongues in peace and war-leaders in crisis; cities build faster, yet centralized armies stay lean.
nation_type_description_theocracy: State ruled by clergy as law; faith guides every decree; clergy veto secular ambitions.
nation_type_description_timocracy: Rule by property-owning warriors; wealthy veterans bankroll armies, but rule by the rich fuels resentment.
nation_type_description_trade_league: Alliance of trade-focused cities; merchants band for mutual defense, though members undermine bold war plans.
nation_type_description_triarchy: Three-seat council votes in a chair chosen for diplomacy and renown; states rally behind the pact while kingdom-wide levies shrink.
nation_type_description_tribal_confedera: Elder council picks renowned mediators to steer the tribes; states gain loyalty while central levies stay light.
nation_type_description_tsardom: Slavic-style absolute monarchy; divine-right crown unifies many peoples, while isolation breeds clumsy diplomacy.
nation_type_description_union: Unified body formed from many groups; unified platform boosts collective bargaining, but varied factions dilute focus.
plot_xntm_change_nation_type_info: Steer the realm toward a fitting nation type ({TYPE}).
plot_xntm_change_nation_type_info_base: Steer the realm toward a fitting nation type.

xntm_bw_ceasefire: $attacker$ and $defender$ pause the fighting in a ceasefire over $reason$.
xntm_bw_conditional: $defender$ yields limited concessions to $attacker$ to avoid total defeat ($reason$).
xntm_bw_mediated: A third power mediates peace between $attacker$ and $defender$ ($reason$).
xntm_bw_puppet: $defender$ submits as a puppet state to $attacker$ to end the war ($reason$).
xntm_bw_tribute: $defender$ will pay ongoing tribute to $attacker$ instead of losing land ($reason$).
xntm_bw_white_peace: $attacker$ and $defender$ agree to a white peace ($reason$).
